edu.first.module

Class Module.StartardModule

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.first.module.Module.StartardModule
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Module
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GyroscopeModule
    Enclosing interface:
    Module

    public abstract static class Module.StartardModule
extends java.lang.Object
implements Module
    A default implementation of Module that provides a simpler interface for building modules on.

    It fulfills theses elements of the Module contract:

    • Between calling enable() and disable(), isEnabled() will return true. Only enable() and disable() can effect the output of isEnabled().
    • If a function is called while the module is disabled, the function should throw a IllegalStateException. (see ensureEnabled())
    • The state of isEnabled() should be thread-safe and only return true when it is completely enabled.

    Parts that are not guaranteed by this class:

    • Modules contain methods specific to their purpose, but do not expose their composed instances for security reasons
    • Modules are "ready" to work when Module.init() has been called, and its functions will work after enable() is called.
    • "Settings" of a module, AKA its internal state, are changeable even when disabled.
    • Calling any of the methods more than once in a row will not behave differently because of it. (see enableModule() and disableModule())
    Since:
    May 22 13

    • Method Detail

      • enableModule

        public abstract void enableModule()
        Performs the necessary actions to ensure the module is operational. The module's functions should work after this method is called, provided this method did not throw an error.

      • disableModule

        public abstract void disableModule()
        Performs the necessary actions to ensure the module cannot be used. The module's functions should not work after this method is called, provided this method did not throw an error.

      • enable

        public final void enable()
        Performs the necessary actions to ensure the module is operational. The module's functions should work after this method is called, provided this method did not throw an error.

        The contract for this method is that Module.isEnabled() should return true after this is called until Module.disable() is called. The official enabled state of a module is only technically correct by using Module.isEnabled() and the completion of this method does not by definition mean that the module is enabled. By contract though, completion of this method without error should mean that it is enabled.

        Specified by:
        enable in interface Module

      • disable

        public final void disable()
        Performs the necessary actions to ensure the module cannot be used. The module's functions should not work after this method is called, provided this method did not throw an error.

        The contract for this method is that Module.isEnabled() should return falsee after this is called until Module.enable() is called. The official enabled state of a module is only technically correct by using Module.isEnabled() and the completion of this method does not by definition mean that the module is disabled. By contract though, completion of this method without error should mean that it is disabled.

        Specified by:
        disable in interface Module

      • isEnabled

        public final boolean isEnabled()
        Returns the enabled state of the module, indicating whether its functions should work. This method should be thread-safe and only return true if the module is fully enabled.

        When modules are not enabled, their functions (apart from "settings", outlined in this class documentation) will throw an IllegalStateException.

        Specified by:
        isEnabled in interface Module
        Returns:
        if module is currently fully functional

      • ensureEnabled

        public final void ensureEnabled()
        When this method is called and the module is not enabled, it will throw an IllegalStateException.

        Use this method at the start of all functions of the method that require the module to be enabled.

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - when module is not enabled
        See Also:
        for more information on contract of throwing an IllegalStateException

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns the name of the class, according to Object.getClass() and Class.getName().
        Overrides:

        Returns:
        name of module's class
